item.title: Youdied method: keeping items?
item.dc:creator: @Hockey4lifexx Hockey4lifexx
item.description:
@Hockey4lifexx wrote:

try this 1, make sure u keep urs on a seperate notepad just incase it doesnt work for u :

public void youdied() { for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) { remove(item, r); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("ERROR: Removing Equipment"); } } for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) { try { if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) { //createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1); ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false); //createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]); deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]); } } catch(Exception e) { } } removeAllItems(); for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) { try { int item = playerEquipment[r]; if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) { remove(item, r); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("ERROR: Removing Equipment"); } } for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) { try { if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) { //createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1); ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false); //createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]); deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), playerItemsN[rr]); } } catch(Exception e) { } } removeAllItems(); teleportToX = 2440; teleportToY = 3089; //pEmote = 15; //pWalk = 13; sendMessage("Oh dear you died!"); hitDiff = 0; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Read full topic

item.title: Youdied method: keeping items?
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Here is my youdied method

[code]public void youdied() {

	for(int i=0; i<playerEquipment.length; i++) {
		try {
			remove(playerEquipment[i], i);
		} catch(Exception E) {}
	}
	if (ProtItem && freeSlots() > 0) {
            	keepItem1();
		deleteItem(keepItem, getItemSlot(keepItem), keepItemAmount);
	}
	for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) {
		try {
			int item = playerEquipment[r];
			if((item > 0) && (item < 10000)) {
				remove(item, r);
			}
		} catch(Exception e) {}
	}
	for(int rr=0; rr<playerItems.length; rr++) {
		try {
			if(playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 10000) {
				ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
				deleteItem(playerItems[rr]-1, getItemSlot(playerItems[rr]-1), 1); 
			}
		} catch(Exception e) {  }
	}
	try {
		ItemHandler.addItem(526, absX, absY, 1, KillerId, false);
	} catch(Exception e) {}
	try {
	} catch(Exception e) {}
	updateRequired = true;
	appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
	if (ProtItem && freeSlots() > 0) {
		if(keepItem != 0)
		addItem(keepItem, keepItemAmount);
	}
	resetKeepItem();
}

[/code]
But if you have a full inventory and equipment on, when you die, it will keep saying ‘not enough space in your inventory’ and keep all your equipment?

Read full topic
